name: Congee
author: Mark Miller
summary: Congee, a Chinese rice porridge, will make any cold winter's day warm and welcoming. This recipe, also known as 'jook', was inspired by my Grandmother's frequent preparation of this dish. You will enjoy congee's unique velvety and savory taste.
ingredients: 2 (6 ounce) fillets lean white fish, sliced
¼ cup sliced Chinese roast pork
½ teaspoon vinegar, or to taste
½ teaspoon soy sauce, or to taste
directions: Combine chicken stock, water, rice, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, fish sauce, ginger, salt, and sesame oil in a large stockpot; bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer until congee has thickened to the consistency of a light porridge, about 3 hours
Stir fish into congee and simmer until cooked through, about 10 minutes
Serve congee in bowls topped with pickled vegetables, roast pork, scallions, and peanuts
Drizzle 1/2 teaspoon vinegar and soy sauce over toppings
